item.title: Report X-2024010808
item.description:
Report X-2024010808

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-01T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-02
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was slightly wet; upon inspection it appears that one of the plastic jugs had a loose cap, a minimal amount of liquid has leaked out, approx. 1 Pint. DPR was completed, package is in red salvage drum, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: Top of plastic bottle, cap was loose and contents leaked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to HazMat cage, placed in red tub and inspected. The one loose cap was tightened and is not leaking now. The remaining 3 Jugs are completely full and undamaged.

item.title: Report X-2024010658
item.description:
Report X-2024010658

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-01T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-02
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While unloading package from trailer , it was noticed that a small wet spot was observed. The wet spot was visual from the exterior of the box and when opened the interior of the box also showed evidence of leakage. Upon closure inspection it was noted that cap may have been loose and this caused minimal amount of leakage. DescribePack: Loose closure/cap on the top of plastic jug. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightened and leakage stopped.

item.title: Report E-2024010455
item.description:
Report E-2024010455

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-30T15:10:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: NORTH HUNTINGDON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XPB experienced a UN3261 Glypure 99 release from a 45-pound fiber drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 cup of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged pail and released product were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024010649
item.description:
Report X-2024010649

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-01T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-29
  • City: NORTH WALES
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package brought to QA attention on 12/30 and was immediately moved to Hazmat Processing area by QA. DescribePack: Package refused on delivery, recip noticed damage on box. Inner contents 4 2.5L bottles, one bottle cap was loose. Small amount dripped onto outer box, and bleached the packaging. No further release or spillage visible. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package taken off truck/dock and immediately moved to Hazmat Processing area by QA.
